Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Amazing. She's normal, absolutely healthy. If you didn't know any better, you'd think nothing had happened to her.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Yeah. I can't wait to slice up her brain and trace her neural pathways.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Screw you, Matt.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Well maybe not right away.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: We should celebrate.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: To the finest research team I've ever known.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Hey...

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I thought you'd gone.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Where would I go?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: A little "I am become death... the shatterer of worlds"?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Something like that.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Since the day I met, all you wanted to do was change the world.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Actually it does.  I guess since you were there from the beginning, you know me better than anyone else on this godforsaken planet.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: You're positively maudlin. You should be happy. Do you have any idea what you've accomplished?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Yeah... but I was working so hard, I didn't realize I'd have no one to share it with.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: What was that about?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Nothing. It's just... He is who he is. Sometimes I just have to be reminded.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: What's it like? Talk goddamnit! Tell me what it's like!

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: To successful phase-shift a human being out of quantum sync with the visible universe and then return him safely, with no after affects.

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: But now?

Speaker: general
Dialogue: How long?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Sir?

Speaker: general
Dialogue: Son, as you can imagine, we are very anxious to field test this tactical asset. How long till you resolve this issue?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Shouldn't be more than another year, Sir.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Yo. Reality check! What the hell was that about?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Keep your voice down.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: The protocol works. Why'd you tell them it didn't?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I wasn't ready for them to know.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: But they're the oversight committee. They're supposed to know.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I'm sure he had a reason.  You did have a reason, didn't you, Sebastian?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I had more than a reason. I had a goddamn epiphany.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: It's their money, Sebastian. It's going to happen eventually.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I know. But not yet. There's too much for us to learn. I don't want my hands tied by their political agenda when we go to phase three.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Well, then... mind telling us how you're gonna get a human test-subject for phase three without the committee finding out?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: That's easy. I've decided to test the procedure ...

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: ... on myself.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Are you nuts?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Was Jonas Salk nuts?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Yeah. Pretty sure he was.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: And remember, for every Jonas Salk, there are a bunch of guys who aren't famous cuz they died.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: If we're that unsure, how can we morally justify testing it on someone else?

Speaker: janice
Dialogue: Isn't it a little soon to be moving into phase three anyway?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: She's right. We haven't even finished collating the phase two research.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: We'll have plenty of time to collate and cross-reference later. Monkey data doesn't matter anyway. The only real data is human data.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: You don't even know if any of the protocols will work on humans.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: How are we gonna find out? Besides, we've succeeded with a gorilla and their DNA is 98% the same as humans. And the 2% is not that significant.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Sebastian ... humans can talk, build houses and cook in microwave ovens. Gorilla's live in trees. That's a helluva 2% if you ask me.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: We're all concerned. I know that. But if we're gonna move forward ever, this is something we have to do.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Why you? Why not one of us?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: The risks. I couldn't ask...

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: What if we volunteer?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: What if you're too valuable to lose?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I'm Project Leader. It's my formula and my call. The best way to express your concern is to make damn sure you do your best work. I'll want about four weeks to...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: To put your affairs in order?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: To run some more reversions and tissue tests and then we'll attempt the phase shift. I'll stay shifted for three days of testing and then we'll perform a quantum regression.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Come in.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: In the past six years, I've never once challenged your decisions, but this ... Sebastian. I don't think you should do this.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You don't understand.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Oh please. How long were we together? You must've said it a million times ... Nobody knows who built the lunar lander. All they remember in the first man on the moon.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Lin, trust me... nothing's going to happen.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: He refuses to listen to reason.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Can we talk about this later? I'm trying to make love to you.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Sorry. I just can't let it go.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: I know how you're feeling. Hell, he and I've been friends since freshman year.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: So how can we let him do this?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: What if you were given the opportunity to be the first person on ,Mars, would you go?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: In a heartbeat.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: What if they didn't know whether or not they could get you home?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Let me ask another question.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Is about who gets to be on top?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Is the human race really ready for what we're doing?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Why do you always get philosophical before we're about to get physical?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: No really. Is it ready? We're barrelling down a road that begs moral and ethical questions that I don't think we can answer.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: They said the same thing about the bomb. They said we'd never survive the nuclear age... but here we are.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: This night is still young.  I mean, when you think about it, it's creepy. Do we really want to live in a world where people can just disappear in the blink of an eye?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: We made our deal with the devil years ago. Might as well stick around to cash in.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: We're ready.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: It's not too late to back out. I'm happy to take your place.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: No. I'm ready.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Nervous?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: A little.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Ever tell you the one about Superman and Wonder Woman?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I don't think so.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: So Superman's flying around the city, and he's horny as hell.  Lo and behold he looks down and sees Wonder Woman, completely nude, sunning herself up on the roof of the Justice League. I mean she is lying there naked and spread eagle. So Superman starts thinking, "man... this is too easy. I could go down there, do a little fast pumping and be gone before she even sees me." After all he is faster than a speeding bullet, right? Anyway, he swoops down, takes care of business so quick, you can't even see him. Well ... I tell ya. Wonder Woman looks up, surprised as hell and says "What the hell was that." And the Invisible Man replies "I dunno know, but it sure hurt like hell."

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You know, that could be the last joke I ever hear.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: C'mon, man. That's funny shit.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: O.K. How're you feeling?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Fine.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Pulse 88, BP 140 over 95. A bit elevated.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: To be expected.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: No reason for concern. He's ready.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Hey... it's gonna be okay.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Start recording.

Speaker: janice
Dialogue: We're hot. All systems nominal, Houston.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Okay, kids. Let's make some history.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Subject: Male, Age 29, weight 166 lbs.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Ready.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I'll inject myself. If anything goes wrong, they can't blame you.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: We can still shut down, Sebastian.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Any last words?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Yeah. If I'm killed, pretend I said something deep and clever.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Injection was administered at

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Nothing so far.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Vitals are stable.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Nothing's happening.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Human DNA structure is slightly more complex... it's possible that it may take more time...

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Maybe we overlooked something.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Recheck the protocol. It can't be non- reactive.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Kinda like a firecracker with a bad fuse...

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Frank?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Goddammit.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Here we go.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Shit... it's starting to burn... Oh god. It hurts. I didn't think it would hurt.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Heartbeat's elevated. Pulse at 100. ... 130 ...

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: What do you feel? Keep talking. KEEP TALKING!

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Pain!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Pulse is 165 ... 170 Blood pressure

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: He's going to blow out his heart.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Prop the crash cart.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: We've got to stop it!

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: We can't!

Speaker: janice
Dialogue: Something's happening.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Listen up! Electric activity increasing in all limbs. Brainwaves are through the roof.

Speaker: janice
Dialogue: I didn't think the human brain could spike that high.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Maybe it can't.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: No. Oh god! NO! STOP IT! STOP IT!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Pulse is 180 .... holding stable.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Holy shit.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Pulse is dropping. 170..

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Bio-quantum phase shift occurred at

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Is he dead?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: No. He passed out from the trauma.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Vitals returning to normal. Pulse 110 ... dropping. Blood pressure 130 over

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Un-fucking-believable.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: You did it, Sebastian. You're the first.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Let's get him into recovery.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: S'okay. You nodded off.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: His breathing's hypnotic. How long's it been?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Seventeen hours.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Where are the others?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: In the lab crunching numbers. We've got enough data there for two lifetimes of research.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I keep looking at that hole, wondering if he's really there.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: He may be coming out of it.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: The lights! Turn off the goddamn lights! Ah Christ!

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Your eyelids are transparent.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: So I ... I'm...

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: My arms. I can.. where? ... I can feel them...

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Your arms ... your whole body... It worked, Sebastian. It worked.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Mirror. I ... I want to see.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Over here in the corner.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: I ... It's hard to think.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: It was painful?

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: At first... but then everything went black. I couldn't see or hear or feel anything. It was all just black... like I wasn't connected.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Your system received quite a shock.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: At least my senses are starting to return... You're wearing your Shalimar, aren't you?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Sebastian.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: This is weird. I'm looking through myself at the floor. I'm looking right through myself. I can't tell ...

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Sebastian?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Sebastian?

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: You really can't see me. Can you?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Gimme symptoms. Dizziness, nausea, headache, body-ache, disorientation.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: No, just tired.  It's funny. I can see everything... more than before... but I can't see myself.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Hey. How's he doing?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Why don't you ask him?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Sebastian, how do you feel.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Not to bad, considering.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: He can't close his eyes so they're sensitive to light.

Speaker: janice
Dialogue: So, what was it like?

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Over here.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: C'mon Sebastian. Knock it off.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Sorry. Couldn't resist.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I feel like we're playing Marco Polo.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Well, I see the procedure hasn't changed your personality.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: No worries. I'm on it.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Boy, you people have no sense of humor.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Stop there.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: It's late. Time you got some rest.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Just a little longer.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Hate to pull rank, but you're my patient now and you need rest. We've got a busy day tomorrow.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Fine.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: We've set up a thermal camera for observation and I've arranged one of us to be here 24/7 in case you need anything. The team's gonna be on alpha- call alert for the duration. If anything goes wrong, we can all be here within...

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Thirty minutes. Yes,,_I know. I wrote the procedure.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I was trying to be reassuring.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: You like this don't you?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Being in charge.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Please. I'm just doing my job.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: You gonna be okay?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Fine. It's not like I have anything else going on in my sad pathetic life.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Carter'll be in at six to spell you and I'll be in by nine. Call me if anything happens, okay?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I'm fine. Go on ahead.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Man, I'm tired. That was a long day.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Days only get longer from here.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Sarah. Are you awake?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Dr. Caine! Goddamnit, Dr. Caine! Are you in here?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Shit.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I found him later in the lab, running samples.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Why didn't you call me?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Because I wasn't sure. I'm still not. I mean, I could've easily been dreaming.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: It doesn't sound like something Sebastian would do.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: God, I feel so stupid.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I can talk to him.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: No. I mean...  It was probably nothing. I shouldn't've mentioned it.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: You sure?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm sure. I mean, y'know, why would he do that, right? Just, this place at night can be kinda creepy, y'know.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: So, how was your first night?

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Restless. Hard to sleep when you can't close your eyes.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Yeah? What'd you do?

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Got up a couple of times. Knocked about.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Yeah, Sarah mentioned you weren't in your cubicle. She said she called you over the intercom and you didn't respond.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I guess I didn't hear. I had the radio on.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: It'd be helpful to us if you'd tell whoever's on duty where you're going to. I mean, if something were to happen, we'd want to know where to find you.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I didn't think it was a problem.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: It isn't. I just don't want it to become one.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Next I want to run a VV and UVF analysis of the platelets.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: We'll have to draw some more blood.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Yeah. Why?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You just seem a little nervous.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: No. I...I'm fine. Hold still. This might hurt a bit.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: No. I was looking at the clock. Why?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Just felt like someone was staring at me.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Sebastian? Goddamnit.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: You've no idea how much fun I've had. I'm going to hate going back.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: That's what worries me.?

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: How so?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: What happens when we turn the project over to the Army. Ever wonder how much fun they're gonna have?

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Maybe we won't give it to them. His voice comes from behind her now.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Stop it, Sebastian. It's not funny.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Well, don't do it for me. Do it for science.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Grow up.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Oh well. Missed your big chance.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Got some sleep. Big day tomorrow.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Recording?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Recording. Subject Doctor Sebastian Caine. Currently in phase shift... Three days, seven hours.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: De-Phase protocol. Injecting Serial Protein Caine One Two Seven.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Not really. I was just starting to enjoy myself.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Tough.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Okay, man. Here we go.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Wait... something... something doesn't feel right.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Heartbeat elevated.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Vitals still nominal..

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I can't br... br...

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: He's not breathing.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Subject manifesting.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Pulse erratic.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Carter!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Get a tranq. Stat.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: He's reverting. Got him on the table.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I got no pulse. No pulse.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Start CPR.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Getting a pulse.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Holy shit. What happened?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Sebastian... can you hear me? Can you hear me? How are his pupils?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: I can't see his goddamn pupils!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I think he's going into shock.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Just got the tissue sample results. Cellular cohesion is stable.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Guess so.  I was just thinking about the Apollo missions. Y'know? Grissom, White and Chaffee... What it was like for them on that launch pad that day, thinking they were gonna reach the stars only to burn to death.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Sometimes the test pilots make history. Sometimes the planes crash and people die.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: But he didn't die, did he?  What if we can't bring him back? What then?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: It's just a little hitch is all. He'll be the first to tell that he'll crack it and I'm sure he will. It'll just take time.  Listen, let's got out of here. We could drive up to the old observatory. We'll take some wine and go count the stars and forget all this for awhile.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: No. I want to be here for him.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Hey...

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Hey...

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: You look worried. It must've been bad.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: You almost died.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Well, remember your Nietchze. Whatever doesn't kill me, makes me stronger.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I should be making you feel better. Not vice versa.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: I guess if I'm going to be stuck this way for awhile, I'd better make some adjustments.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Not too bad.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: The latex'll limit the amount of light delivered to my optic nerves.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: You could almost pass for human.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Well, it gives you a face to talk to at least, and we can all work in normal light again.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: The testing's making me sick.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Could be the barium or the radiation.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: You're physiology has changed and, well, all bets are off.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I can't believe I have to spend another night here.  Suppose you're gonna go home now, meet up with that boyfriend of yours now.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Do you want me to stay?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: No. That's okay. It's just, being a guinea pig is more work than I thought. I'll be fine.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Dr. Caine. What's up?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Just stopped by to let you know, I'm going out for a bit.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Going out? Hey wait a sec!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: What do you mean going out for a bit?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: If I don't get out of here, I'm gonna go crazy.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: But you're not supposed to leave the compound.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: That's the rule.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Yes, but I made that rule. It's my rule and I'm changing it.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You can't just change it.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Carter, I was suppose to be like this for three days. Three fucking days and I'll be damned if I'm going to spend the rest of my life as a prisoner in this godforsaken dump. Now I'm going out. I'll be back in a couple of hours. Okay?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Shit.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Yeah, it's Carter. We got a problem.

Speaker: marine guard
Dialogue: Hey, Doc. Haven't seen you for awhile?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Yeah, well. You know how it in sometimes.

Speaker: marine guard
Dialogue: You got that right, sir. I was beginning to worry 'cause your car hadn't moved.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Thanks, but everything's cool.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: He could be anywhere. Hell he could be right behind us.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I'll meet you at the lab. I'm gonna swing by his place, just in case.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: See you there.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I don't want him to see.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: What a mess.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Shit.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Sebastian?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Sebastian?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Oh shit.

Speaker: janice
Dialogue: What are the tranqs for?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Use your imagination.

Speaker: janice
Dialogue: Are you saying he's dangerous?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: We're just saying we need to be cautious.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: The Metro stops running after midnight and he's on foot, so he can't have gotten too far.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Look, this isn't a monkey we're talking about. It's Dr. Caine. Don't you think you're over reacting?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: This program is classified. If he's out there it means someone might find out about him. He could destroy the whole program.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Relax, Linda. No one's gonna find out.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Where the hell have you been?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I got a little stir crazy, so I went to my apartment to pick up some stuff.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Bullshit! I went to your apartment and I happen to know you did a helluva lot more than pick some stuff up.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: You, of all people How could you?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Just what did you see in my apartment?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I saw your face and your clothes.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: It was bad enough you left without an escort, but to take off the...  out in public?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Don't make a mountain out of molehill. I didn't let anyone see me.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: That's not good enough. When you're outside the lab there are a thousand variables none of us can control. It's just not safe for you to be out there.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Come on, Linda. You don't expect me to be some kind of prisoner.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: You volunteered for this, Sebastian. You knew going in there could be consequences.  For the security of this project, I'm gonna have to ask you to confine yourself to the compound.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I'm still Project Leader, Linda. It's my decision to make.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: You're right. It's your decision. But if you leave the compound again, I'll notify the oversight committee. Then they can make the decision. You understand?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Matt?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Sorry, man. You'd do the same if it were the other way around.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Pack 'em up... Everyone go home.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Hold still.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: How much blood do you think you've taken so far?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Not enough to worry about.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Every day... feels like you're sucking me dry.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: The shoe being on the other foot. You getting to run things.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I didn't ask for this, Caine. But when a classified experiment disappears in the middle of the night, someone's gotta run the show.  Look, I know how hard this has been for you.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Don't patronize me.  And for the record, you've got no idea what it's like. I get up every morning and you people stick needles in me. You bombard me with radiation until I vomit. And then at six it's over for you. You get to go home. But Sebastian is still here. Sebastian can't leave, or else. That's the worst part, you know. Here I have this ... this GIFT and I can't even use it.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Now it's a gift?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You're goddamn right it's a gift. And if you weren't so goddamned short sighted, I'd be out there right now trying to master it.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Where're you going?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Looks like I'm going nowhere.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Come on, man. We've got a ton of tests scheduled today.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Do them yourself.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Want to talk about it?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: "We are the hollow men, the stuffed men, headpieces filled with straw."

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Funny, huh? I've become a literal metaphor.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I don't want to fight you. I just want what's best for the program.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I know. And you being right doesn't make it any easier for me.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: You can be scared. That's okay.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I'm not scared of being stuck this way. With a little more make-up and practice, I could...  ... pass. Y'know, get by in the world. But the testing...

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: You're talking like you've given up. It's only been a few months.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: What if it's years? I don't know how much more testing I can take.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: We've got it. We've got it.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: That's all we need.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Come on, baby. Come on.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Full quantum cascade at 95%.  I'm sorry.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You're sorry? You're fucking sorry?

Speaker: janice
Dialogue: I don't blame him.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I'll go talk to him.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Leave him alone. He just needs to blow off some steam.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I'm going to the lab.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Waste of time. Da Vinci never slept.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Okay. I'm here if you need me.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: How'd it go?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Quiet. He worked in the lab till about 10:30 and then went to sleep.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Ah, my two favorite people. Good morning.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Good morning.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Why so cheery this morning?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You know some days you just wake up feeling the world is full of potential. Like your eyes have been opened.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: I'm happy if I make it to my coffee machine.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I restructured the third genome on your radiated protein strand. Thought you might want to take look.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Cook up a batch and let's see where we go.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I thought you'd want to take a look at it.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I trust you. Now if you'll excuse me, I need to have my head examined.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I'm telling you, I know him. Something's going on.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Think he knows about us.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: If he knew about us, he'd be angry and that wasn't angry.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: When you were a kid, you ever dream about being invisible?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Sure... all the time.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: What did you imagine you'd do?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: The usual.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: What's the usual?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Hanging out in the girl's locker room. Kicking Jimmy Margiani's ass.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Jimmy Margiani?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: School asshole. Drove a red Trans Am. Back then, I was the size of a small planet and made a rather large target.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Ever think up anything along the grand scale?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Sure. World domination. Manipulating stock markets, consolidating a political power base. But those are more recent fantasies.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: And what if it weren't fantasy? What if you were out there in the world and could do whatever you wanted with no consequences whatsoever. How far would go? I mean... if it were real?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I don't know, man. Out in the real world... I mean, there's a responsibility...

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Let's say you saw a woman with amazing tits. Would you brush against them?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Hell, I try and do that now.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Human nature. So if you could get away with more, would you do more?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I read that in a survey at a major university they asked college students "Would you steal if you were guaranteed to get away with it?" 82% said yes.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Eighty two percent? Makes you wonder if the world's ready for what we're doing.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: So, Doc what did you do?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: When you were out.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I just walked around. Y'know.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Aw, you just walked around? Come on. There's more, right?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Like what?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Man, I'd be walking up to people saying shit like "This is God, go,get a haircut." Or hanging out in the changing room at Victoria's Secret.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Kind of sophomoric, don't you think. Besides, it was late and I wasn't out that long.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Well, did you see anybody?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: There was this one girl.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Yeah? And did you mess with her?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Naw...

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Goodnight.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: It's fine. I just didn't know you were there. Goodnight.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: What was it?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: I don't know. I don't see anything.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Thanks. No, just checking. 'Kay, bye.  Phew.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Relax... it's nothing. Where were we?

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Be quiet!

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Shhhh. It's Nobody-It's nothing.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: You awake?

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: I am now.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Notice anything unusual last night.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: No. Why?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Franklin Three. He's dead.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: What of?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: His neck was broken and his windpipe collapsed.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: How'd that happen?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I thought maybe you could tell me.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Sarah... You saying I had something to do with it?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: He was alive last night when I left and he was dead this morning. And you were the only one down here.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: I was in my room all night.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: That's all twelve hours.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: He never left the room.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: A windpipe doesn't just suddenly collapse. Someone or something killed it.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: You saw the tape. The man was in his chamber.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Then we have a problem, because I the cage was locked from the outside. That means it was opened, the dog was killed and the cage was closed and locked again. Only a human could do that.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Well, it wasn't me.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: And it wasn't him.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Are we sure?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Any big plans for tonight?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Quiet night at home. Maybe a book.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Really? Whatever happened to that guy your were seeing?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: He's still in the picture. Why?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Being locked down here, I'm forced to live vicariously. Someday you'll have to tell me what he's like.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Maybe someday I will. See you in the morning.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Au domain.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Hmmm.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Forgot something.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: What the hell?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Pretty clever really. All it does is recycle the signal. He flips this switch, it takes a snapshot and that's all we see.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Asshole.

Speaker: janice
Dialogue: And you think he's violent?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: He killed a dog with his bare hands.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Dogs aren't people. Are we in any danger?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Either way, we aren't equipped to handle this. We have to inform the committee.

Speaker: janice
Dialogue: What if he doesn't come back?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: They'll go after him.  Who has tonight's shift?

Speaker: janice
Dialogue: I do.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Pretend nothing's wrong. Everyone just do what you're doing so he doesn't become suspicious. Okay? Matt and I'll go tell Doctor Kramer and we'll lot the committee deal with it.

Dialogue: I'll call General Caster right now and convene the oversight committee tomorrow.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Thank you, sir.

Dialogue: What do we do in the meantime?

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: Just sit tight and wait for my call.

Dialogue: Just a little trouble at work.

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: In a minute. I have to make a few calls.

Dialogue: Help! HELP! MARTHA! HELP!

Dialogue: What? No good morning for me? Don't you like me anymore?

Dialogue: Oh, sorry. I...I'm in a hurry.

Dialogue: That's okay. It's going to be busy day.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: When did he say held call?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: He's probably meeting with the committee trying to figure out what to do.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I'm gonna call him.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: He's dead. Drowned in his pool last night.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Let me see that.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I'll be right back with help.

Dialogue: Foster One Delta Eight Three Five.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: That's a first.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Foster One Delta Eight Three Five.

Dialogue: Let me try mine.

Dialogue: Kensington Two Romeo One Five Nine.

Dialogue: Tell me this isn't happening.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: We've got a problem.

Dialogue: How long before anybody starts looking for us?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: There's no set check in procedure. It could be weeks.

Dialogue: Already in. It was only a second level encryption.

Dialogue: Some security system.

Dialogue: Oh the system is fine. It's just I'm just extraordinary.

Dialogue: What is it?

Dialogue: There's nothing wrong with the system. Our codes have been removed.

Dialogue: Whose?

Dialogue: Dr. Sebastian Caine.

Dialogue: He's not in there.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Okay, Sebastian. Fun's over. Tell us where you are.

Dialogue: I'm sorry. But I can't lot you turn me in.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Sebastian... where are you?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: C'mon Sebastian. You're scaring me. Tell me where you are and we can talk about it.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Sebastian! Sebastian!  I want search parties. Thermal goggles and tranquilizers.

Dialogue: Dr. Caine? Are you in here? Dr. Caine?

Dialogue: I'm here.

Dialogue: Doctor Caine?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Sebastian?

Dialogue: This is bad.

Dialogue: There's something over there.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: She was strangled. Multiple blows to her head.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Intercom... the phone lines. They're dead.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Gimme that.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: What the fuck is going on here?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Shhh.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Did you find him?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Janice is dead.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: It's clear.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: The man has checked out of reality.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What happened? I don't understand.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Isn't it obvious? Right now, we're the only ones who knows he exists. If he gets rid of us, no one knows and he becomes the most powerful man on earth.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: But he's not a killer.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: He wasn't. He is now.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Can you fix the elevator? Restore our codes?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: It'd take hours to crack the encryptions.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Right now that sounds like good news.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: So what do we do until then. Sit around waiting for him to kill us off?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: No. We find him, before he finds us.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You sure this'll work.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: We designed it to help find the rats we kept dropping in year one. They were too small for thermal scans.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Systems hot. Activating motion detectors.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I've got movement in Corridor Six.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: That's him.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Got 'em.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Check. Check.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Just watch our backs. Hey Carter, ready?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Let's do it.

Dialogue: Take a right at the next accessway. He's working his way back to the offices.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: If we split up, can we trap him on corridor eight?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Going Thermal.

Dialogue: I lost him. Matt, I lost him.

Dialogue: He probably just stopped moving.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: It's me.

Dialogue: Do you have anything?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Nothing.

Dialogue: How did he get by us?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: He couldn't.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Sebastian! We're here to help. Sebastian.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: There. Behind those pipes. He's not moving.

Dialogue: We see him. But he's not responding. The heat signature doesn't move.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: C'mon... C'mon...

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Covered.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: What the...

Dialogue: Looks like... looks like we're pumping out heat...

Dialogue: No fucking shit!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: H...Help... MMmmphg

Dialogue: Where is he? Where the fuck is he?!?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Right on top of you.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Carter's down. Hurt bad. Bleeding from a head wound.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Matt, he's coming toward you.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Shit.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Got outta there.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: He's close!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Goddamnit. The doors are closing. He's shutting me in.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: He's coming right at you!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Twenty, maybe thirty feet.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Goddamnit, I got thermals all over the place. Eight, maybe ten of them. Must be ghosts.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Those signatures ... they're coming from the heating vents.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: I'm starting to lose resolution on my thermals.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Get out of there!

Dialogue: If the room temperature is the same as his body temperature, thermal visors'll be no good.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I'm going!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Linda...it's not safe.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: That's why I'm going.  Corridor eight is clear. Get Carter to the lab. We'll meet you there.

Dialogue: But...

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Do it.

Dialogue: Marco...Polo... Marco... Polo...

Dialogue: So... just out of curiosity, how long has my best friend been fucking my ex- girlfriend.

Dialogue: Sebastian. Get a hold of yourself. You aren't thinking rationally.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: She's a pretty sweet fuck, isn't she?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Calm down, Sebastian... we can talk this through. It's not too late.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: I'm sorry, but I just feel that our friendship is holding me back. I'm sure you understand.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: This way.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: He'll be okay.

Dialogue: It's pretty severe. We have to get him to the lab.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: He's got to be okay.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: For godsakes, help me.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: He was going to kill me.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: I know. He's gone.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: We've got to got out of here.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Habitats.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Oh god. That's right between us and the lab.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: His pulse is faint.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: This'll hold him but he needs blood.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: But...

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Supply is right down the hall. I'll be two seconds.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Sarah, wait for the others

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: If I wait, he'll die. Keep pressure on the wound.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Ahh!  Shit!

Dialogue: He's let the animals out. It wasn't him we were tracking.

Dialogue: It won't kill me unless it gets infected. You?

Dialogue: Me .... Don't ask about me. If he freed all the animals, we could have dozens running around the lab.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: So he could be anywhere right now.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Get to the lab, lock the goddamn doors and pray to God Frank can reprogram the elevator.

Dialogue: Frank?

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: You missed.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Please no. Let me go. Oh god, let me go.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You.

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: I've always liked your feistiness.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Sarah! Sarah!  Goddamnit. Stay with me now. Don't you let up... Sarah! Sarah!

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Where is she?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: She went to the supply room. Carter needed blood.

Dialogue: I said no one goes anywhere alone.

Dialogue: She didn't listen.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: He's dead.

Dialogue: Oh god. Sarah!

Dialogue: Her too?

Dialogue: This didn't happen. This hasn't happened.

Dialogue: It happened alright. Now we have to deal with it.

Dialogue: Yeah? And just what are we supposed to do now?

Dialogue: Now? Now you die.

Dialogue: He's here!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Sebastian!

Dialogue: I would say that what I am experiencing is psychological awareness. I like you being in complete and absolute control.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: You goddamn bastard! You goddamn bastard. You're gonna pay for this. I'm going to bring you back to visibility and then I'm going throw your ass in jail.

Dialogue: You're never gonna bring me back Linda. I never want to come back.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Fuck you!

Speaker: sebastian's voice
Dialogue: Or maybe I'll fuck you. One last time for old times sake.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Don't listen to him. It's not worth it.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Come on, Matt. Let's go get the elevator back on-line so we can got out of this hell hole.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: He does anything, anything at all, come get us. I'll be back to check on you in five.

Dialogue: Imagine you two, carrying on right under my nose. Out of curiosity, what did he give you that I couldn't?

Dialogue: Shut up, Sebastian. He's more of a man than you'll ever be.

Dialogue: Okay, sweetie. I'll be quiet. If that's what you want...

Dialogue: Sebastian? Sebastian? No.. No...

Dialogue: Jesus!

Dialogue: Figured it out? You were always so clever.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: No!

Dialogue: Get out of here!

Dialogue: You won't get away with this. They'll find out about you. They'll hunt you down.

Dialogue: The villagers with their torches? Lock up your daughters! Sorry, Lin. It's not gonna happen that way.

Dialogue: How can you be so brutal?

Dialogue: I guess because I don't have to look at myself in the mirror anymore  Remember that first night I was out? I did something bad, just to see if I could get away with it. And when I did, I realized I could have it all. I can kill in broad daylight. And nobody's gonna tell the police they were fucked by a ghost. Anything I desire I can make happen, but not if people know.

Dialogue: I'm dizzy. I can't feel my legs.

Dialogue: Just keep going. I'll fix you later.

Dialogue: Matt... Matthew. Stay with me now.

Dialogue: He surprised us. We weren't expecting...

Dialogue: Shhh. Don't talk.

Dialogue: Lin...

Dialogue: You feel that?

Dialogue: A little...

Dialogue: Goddamnit.

Dialogue: What're you doing?

Dialogue: This is temporary.

Dialogue: Barely.

Dialogue: Just keeps getting worse.

Dialogue: Oh shit.

Dialogue: There's no way out.

Dialogue: There's got to be.
